avalancheActivity.comment: As a consequence of the strong to storm force wind, fresh snow drift accumulations formed. These can be released by a single winter sport participant in all aspects above approximately 2200 m. The wind slabs have formed in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. Caution is to be exercised at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack. The avalanches can in isolated cases reach large size.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The current avalanche situation calls for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and careful route selection.

snowpackStructure.comment: The northwesterly wind has transported the new snow significantly. In particular at elevated altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. In some cases the wind slabs have bonded still only poorly with each other and the old snowpack. Individual weak layers exist in the snowpack on wind-loaded slopes.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of a strong northwesterly wind, wind slabs formed in the last two days. The mostly small wind slabs are clearly recognisable to the trained eye. At elevated altitudes the avalanche prone locations are more prevalent. The danger of slab avalanches in particular above approximately 2500 m is within the upper range of danger level 2 (moderate). Wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant.
Backcountry touring and snowshoe hiking call for careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment: The northwesterly wind has transported the new snow significantly. In some cases the wind slabs have bonded still only poorly with the old snowpack. In particular at elevated altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. At low altitude only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.

tendency.comment: Temporary increase in danger of dry avalanches as a consequence of the new snow.

avalancheActivity.comment: As a consequence of northwesterly wind, brittle wind slabs formed. The avalanche prone locations are rather rare. The fresh wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in some cases in particular on north to northeast to southeast facing aspects and generally at intermediate and high altitudes. The more recent wind slabs are to be bypassed in very steep terrain.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs are to be found in particular adjacent to ridgelines.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The snowpack is largely stable and has a loosely bonded surface. This applies in particular in shady places that are protected from the wind. In isolated cases new snow is lying on a hard crust.
In all regions only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.

tendency.comment: Temporary increase in danger of dry avalanches as a consequence of the new snow.
